Detailed Description

Class for acquiring and tracking radar targets.

Member Function Documentation

int Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::Connect ( const char *  pSerialNumber,
unsigned  imageStream = 0 
)

Connects to the Radar with the specified 'serialNumber'.

Any existing connection will be automatically disconnected first. The radar must be unlocked before this operation can succeed (see MultiRadarClient.h). This will also create the threads required to listen on the connections made.

Parameters
pSerialNumberSerialNumber of the radar to connect to
imageStreamWhich image-stream/range of the radar to connect to.
Returns
0 if successful, or one of the eErrors (ClientErrors.h) enums if failed
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::Disconnect ( )

Disconnects from the radar.

Stops all threads and releases all channels.

Returns
True if the operation was successful, False otherwise

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::Acquire ( uint32_t  id,
uint32_t  range_m,
uint16_t  bearing_deg,
eBearingType  bearingType 
)

Acquire a target.

Parameters
idThe client id for a target.
range_mThe range where the radar should look to start tracking, in metres.
bearing_degThe bearing where the radar should look to start tracking, in degrees.
bearingTypeIf eAbsolute, the bearing will be interpreted as true north bearing, if eRelative the bearing will be interpreted as relative to the heading of the vessel.
Returns
True if the operation was successful
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::Cancel ( uint32_t  serverID)

Cancel a tracked target.

Also required to release server-ID's of targets that have been lost.

Parameters
serverIDThe id of the target to be cancelled.
Returns
True if the operation was successful
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::CancelAll ( )

Cancel tracking of all targets.

Returns
True if the operation was successful
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::SetBoatSpeed ( eSpeedType  speedType,
uint32_t  speed_dmps,
eDirectionType  directionType,
uint32_t  direction_deg 
)

Sets the vessel speed and direction for use by target-tracking.

Parameters
speedTypeType of speed supplied: eSpeedOverGround (1), eWaterSpeed (2) is the water speed. Only one kind should be provided
speed_dmpsSpeed magnitude expressed in 10ths of a metre per second (ie. deci-metres per second)
directionTypeType of direction supplied: eCoureOverGround (1); eHeadingMagnetic (2); or eHeadingTrue (3)
direction_degDirection of the vessel expressed in degrees.
Returns
True if the operation was successful

bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::SetDangerDistance ( uint32_t  range_m)

Sets the danger zone distance.

Used in connection with the danger zone time (see SetDangerTime) to provide early warning of a possible collision with a target.

Parameters
range_mDanger distance in metres
Returns
True if the operation was successful
bool Navico::Protocol::NRP::tTargetTrackingClient::SetDangerTime ( uint32_t  time_sec)

Sets the danger zone time.

Used in connection with the danger zone distance (see SetDangerDistance) to provide early warning of a possible collision with a target.

Parameters
time_secDanger time in seconds
Returns
True if the operation was successful
